comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Surely "Bryan" is William Jennings Bryan--it looks like him, and he was so prominent, there would only have been a need to mention his last name. According to the Wikipedia article, Bryan supported Wilson in his 1912 presidential bid. And of course, this was Woodrow Wilson while he was governor of New Jersey (1911-1913). The date on the photo is December 12, 1912. (Ah, on edit, I see that someone else had made this identification on another photo.)

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  We'll add the information to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Probably meeting to put his administration together, as Wilson had already been elected president.  Bryan was instrumental in Wilson winning the nomination in the 46th ballot.
